property.name: ozone.container.cache.size
property.description: The open container is cached on the data node side. We maintain an LRU cache for caching the recently used containers. This setting controls the size of that cache.

property.name: ozone.container.cache.lock.stripes
property.description: Container DB open is an exclusive operation. We use a stripe lock to guarantee that different threads can open different container DBs concurrently, while for one container DB, only one thread can open it at the same time. This setting controls the lock stripes.

property.name: dfs.container.ipc
property.description: The ipc port number of container.

property.name: dfs.container.ipc.random.port
property.description: Allocates a random free port for ozone container. This is used only while running unit tests.

property.name: dfs.container.chunk.write.sync
property.description: Determines whether the chunk writes in the container happen as sync I/0 or buffered I/O operation.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.statemachinedata.sync.timeout
property.description: Timeout for StateMachine data writes by Ratis.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.statemachinedata.sync.retries
property.description: Number of times the WriteStateMachineData op will be tried before failing, if this value is -1, then this retries indefinitely.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.queue.num-elements
property.description: Limit for the number of operations in Ratis Log Worker.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for Ratis Log Worker queue.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.appender.queue.num-elements
property.description: Limit for number of append entries in ratis leader's log appender queue.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.appender.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for ratis leader's log appender queue.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.log.purge.gap
property.description: Purge gap between the last purged commit index and the current index, when the leader decides to purge its log.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.datanode.storage.dir
property.description: This directory is used for storing Ratis metadata like logs. If this is not set then default metadata dirs is used. A warning will be logged if this not set. Ideally, this should be mapped to a fast disk like an SSD.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem HDDS data will be stored. Defaults to dfs.datanode.data.dir if not specified. The directories should be tagged with corresponding storage types ([SSD]/[DISK]/[ARCHIVE]/[RAM_DISK]) for storage policies. The default storage type will be DISK if the directory does not have a storage type tagged explicitly.

property.name: hdds.datanode.container.db.dir
property.description: Determines where the per-disk rocksdb instances will be stored. This setting is optional. If unspecified, then rocksdb instances are stored on the same disk as HDDS data. The directories should be tagged with corresponding storage types ([SSD]/[DISK]/[ARCHIVE]/[RAM_DISK]) for storage policies. The default storage type will be DISK if the directory does not have a storage type tagged explicitly. Ideally, this should be mapped to a fast disk like an SSD.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dir.du.reserved
property.description: Reserved space in bytes per volume. Always leave this much space free for non dfs use. Such as /dir1:100B, /dir2:200MB, means dir1 reserves 100 bytes and dir2 reserves 200 MB.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dir.du.reserved.percent
property.description: Percentage of volume that should be reserved. This space is left free for other usage. The value should be between 0-1. Such as 0.1 which means 10% of volume space will be reserved.

property.name: hdds.datanode.volume.choosing.policy
property.description: The class name of the policy for choosing volumes in the list of directories. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.volume.RoundRobinVolumeChoosingPolicy. This volume choosing policy selects volumes in a round-robin order.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.enabled
property.description: Ozone supports different kinds of replication pipelines. Ratis is one of the replication pipeline supported by ozone.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.ipc
property.description: The ipc port number of container for clients.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.admin.port
property.description: The ipc port number of container for admin requests.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.server.port
property.description: The ipc port number of container for server-server communication.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.ipc.random.port
property.description: Allocates a random free port for ozone ratis port for the container. This is used only while running unit tests.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.rpc.type
property.description: Ratis supports different kinds of transports like netty, GRPC, Hadoop RPC etc. This picks one of those for this cluster.

property.name: dfs.ratis.snapshot.threshold
property.description: Number of transactions after which a ratis snapshot should be taken.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.statemachine.max.pending.apply-transactions
property.description: Maximum number of pending apply transactions in a data pipeline. The default value is kept same as default snapshot threshold dfs.ratis.snapshot.threshold.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.num.write.chunk.threads.per.volume
property.description: Maximum number of threads in the thread pool that Datanode will use for writing replicated chunks. This is a per configured locations! (10 thread per disk by default).

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.leader.pending.bytes.limit
property.description: Limit on the total bytes of pending requests after which leader starts rejecting requests from client.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.replication.level
property.description: Replication level to be used by datanode for submitting a container command to ratis. Available replication levels are ALL and MAJORTIY, MAJORITY is used as the default replication level.

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.num.container.op.executors
property.description: Number of executors that will be used by Ratis to execute container ops.(10 by default).

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.segment.size
property.description: The size of the raft segment used by Apache Ratis on datanodes. (1 MB by default)

property.name: dfs.container.ratis.segment.preallocated.size
property.description: The size of the buffer which is preallocated for raft segment used by Apache Ratis on datanodes.(16 KB by default)

property.name: dfs.ratis.server.retry-cache.timeout.duration
property.description: Retry Cache entry timeout for ratis server.

property.name: dfs.ratis.leader.election.minimum.timeout.duration
property.description: The minimum timeout duration for ratis leader election. Default is 5s.

property.name: hdds.node.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send node report. Each datanode periodically send node report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.container.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send container report. Each datanode periodically send container report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.crl.status.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send CRL status report. Each datanode periodically sends CRL status report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.pipeline.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send pipeline report. Each datanode periodically send pipeline report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.prometheus.endpoint.enabled
property.description: Enable prometheus compatible metric page on the HTTP servers.

property.name: hdds.profiler.endpoint.enabled
property.description: Enable /prof java profiler servlet page on HTTP server.

property.name: ozone.administrators
property.description: Ozone administrator users delimited by the comma. If not set, only the user who launches an ozone service will be the admin user. This property must be set if ozone services are started by different users. Otherwise, the RPC layer will reject calls from other servers which are started by users not in the list.

property.name: ozone.administrators.groups
property.description: Ozone administrator groups delimited by the comma. This is the list of groups who can access admin only information from ozone. It is enough to either have the name defined in ozone.administrators or be directly or indirectly in a group defined in this property.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.container.limit.per.interval
property.description: A maximum number of containers to be scanned by block deleting service per time interval. The block deleting service spawns a thread to handle block deletions in a container. This property is used to throttle the number of threads spawned for block deletions.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: A maximum number of blocks to be deleted by block deleting service per time interval. This property is used to throttle the actual number of block deletions on a data node per container.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.interval
property.description: Time interval of the block deleting service. The block deleting service runs on each datanode periodically and deletes blocks queued for deletion. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.timeout
property.description: A timeout value of block deletion service. If this is set greater than 0, the service will stop waiting for the block deleting completion after this time. If timeout happens to a large proportion of block deletion, this needs to be increased with ozone.block.deleting.limit.per.task. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified, then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.workers
property.description: Number of workers executed of block deletion service. This configuration should be set to greater than 0.

property.name: ozone.UnsafeByteOperations.enabled
property.description: It specifies whether to use unsafe or safe buffer to byteString copy.

property.name: ozone.client.connection.timeout
property.description: Connection timeout for Ozone client in milliseconds.

property.name: ozone.client.socket.timeout
property.description: Socket timeout for Ozone client. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.key.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: A maximum number of keys to be scanned by key deleting service per time interval in OM. Those keys are sent to delete metadata and generate transactions in SCM for next async deletion between SCM and DataNode.

property.name: ozone.om.service.ids
property.description: Comma-separated list of OM service Ids. This property allows the client to figure out quorum of OzoneManager address.

property.name: ozone.om.internal.service.id
property.description: Service ID of the Ozone Manager. If this is not set fall back to ozone.om.service.ids to find the service ID it belongs to.

property.name: ozone.om.nodes.EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID
property.description:
Comma-separated list of OM node Ids for a given OM service ID (eg. EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID). The OM service ID should be the value (one of the values if there are multiple) set for the parameter ozone.om.service.ids.
Decommissioned nodes (represented by node Ids in ozone.om.decommissioned.nodes config list) will be ignored and not included in the OM HA setup even if added to this list.
Unique identifiers for each OM Node, delimited by commas. This will be used by OzoneManagers in HA setup to determine all the OzoneManagers belonging to the same OMservice in the cluster. For example, if you used “omService1” as the OM service ID previously, and you wanted to use “om1”, “om2” and "om3" as the individual IDs of the OzoneManagers, you would configure a property ozone.om.nodes.omService1, and its value "om1,om2,om3".

property.name: ozone.om.decommissioned.nodes.EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID
property.description: Comma-separated list of OM node Ids which have been decommissioned. OMs present in this list will not be included in the OM HA ring.

property.name: ozone.om.node.id
property.description:
The ID of this OM node. If the OM node ID is not configured it is determined automatically by matching the local node's address with the configured address.
If node ID is not deterministic from the configuration, then it is set to default node id - om1.

property.name: ozone.om.address
property.description: The address of the Ozone OM service. This allows clients to discover the address of the OM.

property.name: ozone.om.handler.count.key
property.description: The number of RPC handler threads for OM service endpoints.

property.name: ozone.om.http-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the OM web UI will listen on.
If the port is 0, then the server will start on a free port. However, it is best to specify a well-known port, so it is easy to connect and see the OM management UI.

property.name: ozone.om.http-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the OM web server will bind to. If this optional the address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.om.http-address.

property.name: ozone.om.http.enabled
property.description: Property to enable or disable OM web user interface.

property.name: ozone.om.https-address
property.description: The address and the base port where the OM web UI will listen on using HTTPS. If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: ozone.om.https-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the OM web server will bind to using HTTPS. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.om.https-address.

property.name: ozone.om.volume.listall.allowed
property.description: Allows everyone to list all volumes when set to true. Defaults to true. When set to false, non-admin users can only list the volumes they have access to. Admins can always list all volumes.

property.name: ozone.om.user.max.volume
property.description: The maximum number of volumes a user can have on a cluster.Increasing or decreasing this number has no real impact on ozone cluster. This is defined only for operational purposes. Only an administrator can create a volume, once a volume is created there are no restrictions on the number of buckets or keys inside each bucket a user can create.

property.name: ozone.om.db.dirs
property.description:
Directory where the OzoneManager stores its metadata. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the OM will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the OM will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.metadata.dirs
property.tag: OZONE, OM, SCM, CONTAINER, STORAGE, REQUIRED
property.description:
This setting is the fallback location for SCM, OM, Recon and DataNodes to store their metadata. This setting may be used only in test/PoC clusters to simplify configuration.
For production clusters or any time you care about performance, it is recommended that ozone.om.db.dirs, ozone.scm.db.dirs and dfs.container.ratis.datanode.storage.dir be configured separately.

property.name: ozone.metastore.rocksdb.statistics
property.description: The statistics level of the rocksdb store. If you use any value from org.rocksdb.StatsLevel (eg. ALL or EXCEPT_DETAILED_TIMERS), the rocksdb statistics will be exposed over JMX bean with the choosed setting. Set it to OFF to not initialize rocksdb statistics at all. Please note that collection of statistics could have 5-10% performance penalty. Check the rocksdb documentation for more details.

property.name: ozone.scm.db.dirs
property.description:
Directory where the StorageContainerManager stores its metadata. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the SCM will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the SCM will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.address
property.description: The address of the Ozone SCM block client service. If not defined value of ozone.scm.client.address is used.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.bind.host
property.description: The hostname or IP address used by the SCM block client endpoint to bind.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM block client service.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.deletion.max.retry
property.description: SCM wraps up many blocks in a deletion transaction and sends that to data node for physical deletion periodically. This property determines how many times SCM is going to retry sending a deletion operation to the data node.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.size
property.description: The default size of a scm block. This is maps to the default Ozone block size.

property.name: ozone.scm.sequence.id.batch.size
property.description: SCM allocates sequence id in a batch way. This property determines how many ids will be allocated in a single batch.

property.name: ozone.scm.chunk.size
property.description:
The chunk size for reading/writing chunk operations in bytes.
The chunk size defaults to 4MB. If the value configured is more than the maximum size (32MB), it will be reset to the maximum size (32MB). This maps to the network packet sizes and file write operations in the client to datanode protocol.
When tuning this parameter, flow control window parameter should be tuned accordingly. Refer to hdds.ratis.raft.grpc.flow.control.window for more information.

property.name: ozone.chunk.read.buffer.default.size
property.description:
The default read buffer size during read chunk operations when checksum is disabled. Chunk data will be cached in buffers of this capacity.
For chunk data with checksum, the read buffer size will be the same as the number of bytes per checksum (ozone.client.bytes.per.checksum) corresponding to the chunk.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.layout
property.description: Container layout defines how chunks, blocks and containers are stored on disk. Each chunk is stored separately with FILE_PER_CHUNK. All chunks of a block are stored in the same file with FILE_PER_BLOCK. The default is FILE_PER_BLOCK.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.address
property.description:
The address of the Ozone SCM client service. This is a required setting.
It is a string in the host:port format. The port number is optional and defaults to 9860.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.bind.host
property.description:
The hostname or IP address used by the SCM client endpoint to bind. This setting is used by the SCM only and never used by clients.
The setting can be useful in multi-homed setups to restrict the availability of the SCM client service to a specific interface.
The default is appropriate for most clusters.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM client service.

property.name: ozone.scm.keyvalue.container.deletion-choosing.policy
property.description: The policy used for choosing desired keyvalue containers for block deletion. Datanode selects some containers to process block deletion in a certain interval defined by ozone.block.deleting.service.interval. The number of containers to process in each interval is defined by ozone.block.deleting.container.limit.per.interval. This property is used to configure the policy applied while selecting containers. There are two policies supporting now: RandomContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy and TopNOrderedContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy. org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.impl.RandomContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy implements a simply random policy that to return a random list of containers. org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.impl.TopNOrderedContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy implements a policy that choosing top count number of containers in a pending-deletion-blocks's num based descending order.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.placement.impl
property.description: The full name of class which implements org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.PlacementPolicy. The class decides which datanode will be used to host the container replica. If not set, org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.container.placement.algorithms.SCMContainerPlacementRandom will be used as default value.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.placement.ec.impl
property.description: The full name of class which implements org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.PlacementPolicy. The class decides which datanode will be used to host the container replica in EC mode. If not set, org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.container.placement.algorithms.SCMContainerPlacementRandom will be used as default value.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.owner.container.count
property.description: Number of containers per owner per disk in a pipeline.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.per.metadata.disk
property.description: Number of pipelines to be created per raft log disk.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.pipeline.limit
property.description: Max number of pipelines per datanode can be engaged in. Setting the value to 0 means the pipeline limit per dn will be determined by the no of metadata volumes reported per dn.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.disallow.same.peers
property.description: Disallows same set of datanodes to participate in multiple pipelines when set to true. Default is set to false.

property.name: ozone.scm.ratis.pipeline.limit
property.description: Upper limit for how many pipelines can be OPEN in SCM. 0 as default means there is no limit. Otherwise, the number is the limit of max amount of pipelines which are OPEN.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.allocated.timeout
property.description: Timeout for every pipeline to stay in ALLOCATED stage. When pipeline is created, it should be at OPEN stage once pipeline report is successfully received by SCM. If a pipeline stays at ALLOCATED longer than the specified period of time, it should be scrubbed so that new pipeline can be created. This timeout is for how long pipeline can stay at ALLOCATED stage until it gets scrubbed.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.leader-choose.policy
property.description: The policy used for choosing desired leader for pipeline creation. There are two policies supporting now: DefaultLeaderChoosePolicy, MinLeaderCountChoosePolicy. org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.pipeline.leader.choose.algorithms.DefaultLeaderChoosePolicy implements a policy that choose leader without depending on priority. org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.pipeline.leader.choose.algorithms.MinLeaderCountChoosePolicy implements a policy that choose leader which has the minimum exist leader count. In the future, we need to add policies which consider: 1. resource, the datanode with the most abundant cpu and memory can be made the leader 2. topology, the datanode nearest to the client can be made the leader

property.name: ozone.scm.container.size
property.description: Default container size used by Ozone. There are two considerations while picking this number. The speed at which a container can be replicated, determined by the network speed and the metadata that each container generates. So selecting a large number creates less SCM metadata, but recovery time will be more. 5GB is a number that maps to quick replication times in gigabit networks, but still balances the amount of metadata.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.address
property.description:
The address of the Ozone SCM service used for internal communication between the DataNodes and the SCM.
It is a string in the host:port format. The port number is optional and defaults to 9861.
This setting is optional. If unspecified then the hostname portion is picked from the ozone.scm.client.address setting and the default service port of 9861 is chosen.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.bind.host
property.description: The hostname or IP address used by the SCM service endpoint to bind.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.id.dir
property.description: The path that datanodes will use to store the datanode ID. If this value is not set, then datanode ID is created under the metadata directory.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM service.

property.name: ozone.scm.dead.node.interval
property.description: The interval between heartbeats before a node is tagged as dead.

property.name: ozone.scm.handler.count.key
property.description:
The number of RPC handler threads for each SCM service endpoint.
The default is appropriate for small clusters (tens of nodes).
Set a value that is appropriate for the cluster size. Generally, HDFS recommends RPC handler count is set to 20 * log2(Cluster Size) with an upper limit of 200. However, SCM will not have the same amount of traffic as Namenode, so a value much smaller than that will work well too.

property.name: hdds.heartbeat.interval
property.description: The heartbeat interval from a data node to SCM. Yes, it is not three but 30, since most data nodes will heart beating via Ratis heartbeats. If a client is not able to talk to a data node, it will notify OM/SCM eventually. So a 30 second HB seems to work. This assumes that replication strategy used is Ratis if not, this value should be set to something smaller like 3 seconds. ozone.scm.pipeline.close.timeout should also be adjusted accordingly, if the default value for this config is not used.

property.name: hdds.recon.heartbeat.interval
property.description: The heartbeat interval from a Datanode to Recon.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.log.warn.interval.count
property.description: Defines how frequently we will log the missing of a heartbeat to SCM. For example in the default case, we will write a warning message for each ten consecutive heartbeats that we miss to SCM. This helps in reducing clutter in a data node log, but trade off is that logs will have less of this statement.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.rpc-timeout
property.description: Timeout value for the RPC from Datanode to SCM.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.rpc-retry-count
property.description: Retry count for the RPC from Datanode to SCM. The rpc-retry-interval is 1s by default. Make sure rpc-retry-count * (rpc-timeout + rpc-retry-interval) is less than hdds.heartbeat.interval.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.rpc-retry-interval
property.description: Retry interval for the RPC from Datanode to SCM. Make sure rpc-retry-count * (rpc-timeout + rpc-retry-interval) is less than hdds.heartbeat.interval.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.thread.interval
property.description:
When a heartbeat from the data node arrives on SCM, It is queued for processing with the time stamp of when the heartbeat arrived. There is a heartbeat processing thread inside SCM that runs at a specified interval. This value controls how frequently this thread is run.
There are some assumptions build into SCM such as this value should allow the heartbeat processing thread to run at least three times more frequently than heartbeats and at least five times more than stale node detection time. If you specify a wrong value, SCM will gracefully refuse to run. For more info look at the node manager tests in SCM.
In short, you don't need to change this.

property.name: ozone.scm.http-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the SCM web ui will listen on.
If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: ozone.scm.http-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the SCM web server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.scm.http-address.

property.name: ozone.scm.http.enabled
property.description: Property to enable or disable SCM web ui.

property.name: ozone.scm.https-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the SCM web UI will listen on using HTTPS.
If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: ozone.scm.https-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the SCM web server will bind to using HTTPS. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.scm.https-address.

property.name: ozone.scm.names
property.description: The value of this property is a set of DNS | DNS:PORT | IP Address | IP:PORT. Written as a comma separated string. e.g. scm1, scm2:8020, 7.7.7.7:7777. This property allows datanodes to discover where SCM is, so that datanodes can send heartbeat to SCM.

property.name: ozone.scm.stale.node.interval
property.description: The interval for stale node flagging. Please see ozone.scm.heartbeat.thread.interval before changing this value.

property.name: ozone.trace.enabled
property.description: Setting this flag to true dumps the HTTP request/ response in the logs. Very useful when debugging REST protocol.

property.name: ozone.key.preallocation.max.blocks
property.description: While allocating blocks from OM, this configuration limits the maximum number of blocks being allocated. This configuration ensures that the allocated block response do not exceed rpc payload limit. If client needs more space for the write, separate block allocation requests will be made.

property.name: ozone.client.list.cache
property.description: Configuration property to configure the cache size of client list calls.

property.name: ozone.server.default.replication
property.description: Default replication value. The actual number of replications can be specified when writing the key. The default is used if replication is not specified when creating key or no default replication set at bucket. Supported values: For Standalone: 1 For Ratis: 3 For Erasure Coding(EC) supported format: {ECCodec}-{DataBlocks}-{ParityBlocks}-{ChunkSize} ECCodec: Codec for encoding stripe. Supported values : XOR, RS (Reed Solomon) DataBlocks: Number of data blocks in a stripe. ParityBlocks: Number of parity blocks in a stripe. ChunkSize: Chunk size in bytes. E.g. 1024k, 2048k etc. Supported combinations of {DataBlocks}-{ParityBlocks} : 3-2, 6-3, 10-4

property.name: ozone.server.default.replication.type
property.description: Default replication type to be used while writing key into ozone. The value can be specified when writing the key, default is used when nothing is specified when creating key or no default value set at bucket. Supported values: RATIS, STAND_ALONE, CHAINED and EC.

property.name: ozone.client.bucket.replication.config.refresh.time.ms
property.description: Default time period to refresh the bucket replication config in o3fs clients. Until the bucket replication config refreshed, client will continue to use existing replication config irrespective of whether bucket replication config updated at OM or not.

property.name: hdds.container.close.threshold

property.name: ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.service.interval

property.name: ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.service.timeout

property.name: ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.limit.per.task

property.name: hdds.scm.safemode.min.datanode

property.name: ozone.s3g.http.auth.kerberos.principal

property.name: ozone.security.enabled
property.description: True if security is enabled for ozone. When this property is true, hadoop.security.authentication should be Kerberos.

property.name: ozone.http.filter.initializers
property.description: Set to org.apache.hadoop.security.AuthenticationFilterInitializer to enable Kerberos authentication for Ozone HTTP web consoles is enabled using the SPNEGO protocol. When this property is set, ozone.security.http.kerberos.enabled should be set to true.

property.name: ozone.client.read.timeout
property.description: Timeout for ozone grpc client during read.

property.name: ozone.om.unflushed.transaction.max.count
property.description: the unflushed transactions here are those requests that have been applied to OM state machine but not been flushed to OM rocksdb. when OM meets high concurrency-pressure and flushing is not fast enough, too many pending requests will be hold in memory and will lead to long GC of OM, which will slow down flushing further. there are some cases that flushing is slow, for example, 1 rocksdb is on a HDD, which has poor IO performance than SSD. 2 a big compaction is happening internally in rocksdb and write stall of rocksdb happens. 3 long GC, which may caused by other factors. the property is to limit the max count of unflushed transactions, so that the maximum memory occupied by unflushed transactions is limited.

property.name: ozone.om.lock.fair
property.description: If this is true, the Ozone Manager lock will be used in Fair mode, which will schedule threads in the order received/queued. If this is false, uses non-fair ordering. See java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock for more information on fair/non-fair locks.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.enable
property.description: Property to enable or disable Ratis server on OM. Please note - this is a temporary property to disable OM Ratis server.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.port
property.description: The port number of the OzoneManager's Ratis server.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.rpc.type
property.description: Ratis supports different kinds of transports like netty, GRPC, Hadoop RPC etc. This picks one of those for this cluster.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.storage.dir
property.description: This directory is used for storing OM's Ratis metadata like logs. If this is not set then default metadata dirs is used. A warning will be logged if this not set. Ideally, this should be mapped to a fast disk like an SSD. If undefined, OM ratis storage dir will fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.segment.size
property.description: The size of the raft segment used by Apache Ratis on OM. (4 MB by default)

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.segment.preallocated.size

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.log.appender.queue.num-elements

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.log.appender.queue.byte-limit

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.log.purge.gap

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.server.retry.cache.timeout

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.minimum.timeout

property.name: ozone.om.leader.election.minimum.timeout.duration
property.description: DEPRECATED. Leader election timeout uses ratis rpc timeout which can be set via ozone.om.ratis.minimum.timeout.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.server.leaderelection.pre-vote
property.description: Enable/disable OM HA leader election pre-vote phase.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.server.failure.timeout.duration
property.description: The timeout duration for ratis server failure detection, once the threshold has reached, the ratis state machine will be informed about the failure in the ratis ring.

property.name: ozone.om.ratis.snapshot.dir
property.description: This directory is used for storing OM's snapshot related files like the ratisSnapshotIndex and DB checkpoint from leader OM. If undefined, OM snapshot dir will fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.provider.socket.timeout
property.description: Socket timeout for HTTP call made by OM Snapshot Provider to request OM snapshot from OM Leader.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.provider.connection.timeout
property.description: Connection timeout for HTTP call made by OM Snapshot Provider to request OM snapshot from OM Leader.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.provider.request.timeout
property.description: Connection request timeout for HTTP call made by OM Snapshot Provider to request OM snapshot from OM Leader.

property.description: Key to enable/disable ozone acls.

property.description: The keytab file used by OM http server to login as its service principal if SPNEGO is enabled for om http server.

property.name: hdds.key.len

property.description: Directory to store public/private key for SCM CA. This is relative to ozone/hdds meteadata dir.

property.name: hdds.block.token.expiry.time
property.description: Default value for expiry time of block token. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified, then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: ozone.scm.default.service.id
property.description: Service ID of the SCM. If this is not set fall back to ozone.scm.service.ids to find the service ID it belongs to.

property.name: ozone.scm.nodes.EXAMPLESCMSERVICEID
property.description:
Comma-separated list of SCM node Ids for a given SCM service ID (eg. EXAMPLESCMSERVICEID). The SCM service ID should be the value (one of the values if there are multiple) set for the parameter ozone.scm.service.ids.
Unique identifiers for each SCM Node, delimited by commas. This will be used by SCMs in HA setup to determine all the SCMs belonging to the same SCM in the cluster. For example, if you used “scmService1” as the SCM service ID previously, and you wanted to use “scm1”, “scm2” and "scm3" as the individual IDs of the SCMs, you would configure a property ozone.scm.nodes.scmService1, and its value "scm1,scm2,scm3".

property.name: ozone.scm.node.id
property.description:
The ID of this SCM node. If the SCM node ID is not configured it is determined automatically by matching the local node's address with the configured address.
If node ID is not deterministic from the configuration, then it is set to the scmId from the SCM version file.

property.name: ozone.scm.primordial.node.id
property.description:
optional config, if being set will cause scm --init to only take effect on the specific node and ignore scm --bootstrap cmd. Similarly, scm --init will be ignored on the non-primordial scm nodes. The config can either be set equal to the hostname or the node id of any of the scm nodes. With the config set, applications/admins can safely execute init and bootstrap commands safely on all scm instances.
If a cluster is upgraded from non-ratis to ratis based SCM, scm --init needs to re-run for switching from non-ratis based SCM to ratis-based SCM on the primary node.

If undefined, then the Recon will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.scm.network.topology.schema.file
property.description: The schema file defines the ozone network topology. We currently support xml(default) and yaml format. Refer to the samples in the topology awareness document for xml and yaml topology definition samples.

property.name: ozone.network.topology.aware.read
property.description: Whether to enable topology aware read to improve the read performance.

property.name: ozone.recon.om.db.dir
property.description:
Directory where the Recon Server stores its OM snapshot DB. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the Recon will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the Recon will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.recon.om.connection.request.timeout
property.description: Connection request timeout in milliseconds for HTTP call made by Recon to request OM DB snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.om.connection.timeout
property.description: Connection timeout for HTTP call in milliseconds made by Recon to request OM snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.scm.connection.request.timeout
property.description: Connection request timeout in milliseconds for HTTP call made by Recon to request SCM DB snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.scm.connection.timeout
property.description: Connection timeout for HTTP call in milliseconds made by Recon to request SCM snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.om.socket.timeout
property.description: Socket timeout in milliseconds for HTTP call made by Recon to request OM snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.om.snapshot.task.initial.delay
property.description: Initial delay in MINUTES by Recon to request OM DB Snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.om.snapshot.task.interval.delay
property.description: Interval in MINUTES by Recon to request OM DB Snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.om.snapshot.task.flush.param
property.description: Request to flush the OM DB before taking checkpoint snapshot.

property.name: recon.om.delta.update.limit
property.description: Recon each time get a limited delta updates from OM. The actual fetched data might be larger than this limit.

property.name: recon.om.delta.update.loop.limit
property.description: The sync between Recon and OM consists of several small fetch loops.

property.name: ozone.recon.scm.container.threshold
property.description: Threshold value for the difference in number of containers in SCM and RECON.

property.name: ozone.recon.scm.snapshot.enabled
property.description: If enabled, SCM DB Snapshot is taken by Recon.

property.name: hdds.tracing.enabled
property.description: If enabled, tracing information is sent to tracing server.

property.name: ozone.recon.task.thread.count
property.description: The number of Recon Tasks that are waiting on updates from OM.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.admin.monitor.interval
property.description: This sets how frequently the datanode admin monitor runs to check for nodes added to the admin workflow or removed from it. The progress of decommissioning and entering maintenance nodes is also checked to see if they have completed.

property.name: ozone.client.list.trash.keys.max
property.description: The maximum number of keys to return for a list trash request.

property.name: ozone.http.basedir
property.description: The base dir for HTTP Jetty server to extract contents. If this property is not configured, by default, Jetty will create a directory inside the directory named by the java.io.tmpdir System property（/tmp by default）. While in production environment, it's strongly suggested to instruct Jetty to use a different parent directory by setting this property to the name of the desired parent directory. The value of the property will be used to set Jetty context attribute 'org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.basetempdir'. The directory named by this property must exist and be writeable.

property.name: ozone.http.policy
property.description: Decide if HTTPS(SSL) is supported on Ozone This configures the HTTP endpoint for Ozone daemons: The following values are supported: - HTTP_ONLY : Service is provided only on http - HTTPS_ONLY : Service is provided only on https - HTTP_AND_HTTPS : Service is provided both on http and https

property.name: ozone.https.client.need-auth
property.description: Whether SSL client certificate authentication is required

property.name: ozone.https.client.keystore.resource
property.description: Resource file from which ssl client keystore information will be extracted

property.name: ozone.https.server.keystore.resource
property.description: Resource file from which ssl server keystore information will be extracted

property.name: ozone.s3g.client.buffer.size
property.description: The size of the buffer which is for read block. (4KB by default).

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.keypassword
property.description: Keystore key password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.location
property.description: Keystore location for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.password
property.description: Keystore password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.truststore.location
property.description: Truststore location for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.truststore.password
property.description: Truststore password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: hdds.datanode.ratis.server.request.timeout
property.description: Timeout for the request submitted directly to Ratis in datanode.

property.name: ozone.om.keyname.character.check.enabled
property.description: If true, then enable to check if the key name contains illegal characters when creating/renaming key. For the definition of illegal characters, follow the rules in Amazon S3's object key naming guide.

property.name: ozone.om.enable.filesystem.paths
property.description: If true, key names will be interpreted as file system paths. "/" will be treated as a special character and paths will be normalized and must follow Unix filesystem path naming conventions. This flag will be helpful when objects created by S3G need to be accessed using OFS/O3Fs. If false, it will fallback to default behavior of Key/MPU create requests where key paths are not normalized and any intermediate directories will not be created or any file checks happens to check filesystem semantics.

property.name: ozone.om.key.path.lock.enabled
property.description: Defaults to false. If true, the fine-grained KEY_PATH_LOCK functionality is enabled. If false, it is disabled.

property.name: ozone.client.key.provider.cache.expiry
property.description: Ozone client security key provider cache expiration time.

property.name: ozone.scm.info.wait.duration
property.description: Maximum amount of duration OM/SCM waits to get Scm Info/Scm signed cert during OzoneManager init/SCM bootstrap.

property.name: ozone.scm.ca.list.retry.interval
property.description: SCM client wait duration between each retry to get Scm CA list. OM/Datanode obtain CA list during startup, and wait for the CA List size to be matched with SCM node count size plus 1. (Additional one certificate is root CA certificate). If the received CA list size is not matching with expected count, this is the duration used to wait before making next attempt to get CA list.

property.name: ozone.client.key.latest.version.location
property.description: Ozone client gets the latest version location.

property.name: ozone.network.flexible.fqdn.resolution.enabled
property.description: SCM, OM hosts will be able to resolve itself based on its host name instead of fqdn. It is useful for deploying to kubernetes environment, during the initial launching time when [pod_name].[service_name] is not resolvable yet because of the probe.

property.name: ozone.network.jvm.address.cache.enabled
property.description: Disable the jvm network address cache. In environment such as kubernetes, IPs of instances of scm, om and datanodes can be changed. Disabling this cache helps to quickly resolve the fqdn's to the new IPs.

property.name: ozone.directory.deleting.service.interval
property.description: Time interval of the directory deleting service. It runs on OM periodically and cleanup orphan directory and its sub-tree. For every orphan directory it deletes the sub-path tree structure(dirs/files). It sends sub-files to KeyDeletingService to deletes its blocks. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.path.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: A maximum number of paths(dirs/files) to be deleted by directory deleting service per time interval.

property.name: ozone.scm.event.ContainerReport.thread.pool.size
property.description: Thread pool size configured to process container reports.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.ratis.volume.free-space.min
property.description: Minimum amount of storage space required for each ratis volume on a datanode to hold a new pipeline. Datanodes with all its ratis volumes with space under this value will not be allocated a pipeline or container replica.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.storage.dir
property.description: Storage directory used by SCM to write Ratis logs.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.rpc.type
property.description: Ratis supports different kinds of transports like netty, GRPC， Hadoop RPC etc. This picks one of those for this cluster.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.segment.size
property.description: The size of the raft segment used by Apache Ratis on SCM. (4 MB by default)

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.segment.preallocated.size
property.description: The size of the buffer which is preallocated for raft segment used by Apache Ratis on SCM.(4 MB by default)

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.log.appender.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for Raft's Log Worker queue.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.log.appender.queue.num-elements
property.description: Number of operation pending with Raft's Log Worker.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.log.purge.enabled
property.description: whether enable raft log purge.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.log.purge.gap
property.description: The minimum gap between log indices for Raft server to purge its log segments after taking snapshot.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.snapshot.threshold
property.description: The threshold to trigger a Ratis taking snapshot operation for SCM.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.request.timeout
property.description: The timeout duration for SCM's Ratis server RPC.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.server.retry.cache.timeout
property.description: Retry Cache entry timeout for SCM's Ratis server.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.leader.election.timeout
property.description: The minimum timeout duration for SCM ratis leader election. Default is 1s.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.server.leaderelection.pre-vote
property.description: Enable/disable SCM HA leader election pre-vote phase.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.leader.ready.wait.timeout
property.description: The minimum timeout duration for waiting for leader readiness.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.leader.ready.check.interval
property.description: The interval between ratis server performing a leader readiness check.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.server.failure.timeout.duration
property.description: The timeout duration for ratis server failure detection, once the threshold has reached, the ratis state machine will be informed about the failure in the ratis ring.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.snapshot.dir
property.description: The ratis snapshot dir location.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.grpc.deadline.interval
property.description: Deadline for SCM DB checkpoint interval.

property.name: ozone.s3g.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file used by S3Gateway daemon to login as its service principal. The principal name is configured with ozone.s3g.kerberos.principal.

property.name: ozone.s3g.kerberos.principal
property.description: The S3Gateway service principal. Ex: s3g/_HOST@REALM.COM

property.name: hdds.container.checksum.verification.enabled
property.description: To enable/disable checksum verification of the containers.

property.name: hadoop.http.idle_timeout.ms
property.description: OM/SCM/DN/S3GATEWAY Server connection timeout in milliseconds.

property.name: ozone.om.grpc.maximum.response.length
property.description: OM/S3GATEWAY OMRequest, OMResponse over grpc max message length (bytes).

property.name: ozone.default.bucket.layout
property.description: Default bucket layout used by Ozone Manager during bucket creation when a client does not specify the bucket layout option. Supported values are OBJECT_STORE and FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED. OBJECT_STORE: This layout allows the bucket to behave as a pure object store and will not allow interoperability between S3 and FS APIs. FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED: This layout allows the bucket to support atomic rename/delete operations and also allows interoperability between S3 and FS APIs. Keys written via S3 API with a "/" delimiter will create intermediate directories.

property.name: ozone.client.max.ec.stripe.write.retries
property.description: When EC stripe write failed, client will request to allocate new block group and write the failed stripe into new block group. If the same stripe failure continued in newly acquired block group also, then it will retry by requesting to allocate new block group again. This configuration is used to limit these number of retries. By default the number of retries are 10.

property.name: ozone.audit.log.debug.cmd.list.omaudit
property.description: A comma separated list of OzoneManager commands that are written to the OzoneManager audit logs only if the audit log level is debug. Ex: "ALLOCATE_BLOCK,ALLOCATE_KEY,COMMIT_KEY".

property.name: ozone.audit.log.debug.cmd.list.scmaudit
property.description: A comma separated list of SCM commands that are written to the SCM audit logs only if the audit log level is debug. Ex: "GET_VERSION,REGISTER,SEND_HEARTBEAT".

property.name: ozone.audit.log.debug.cmd.list.dnaudit
property.description: A comma separated list of Datanode commands that are written to the DN audit logs only if the audit log level is debug. Ex: "CREATE_CONTAINER,READ_CONTAINER,UPDATE_CONTAINER".

property.name: ozone.om.multitenancy.enabled
property.description: Enable S3 Multi-Tenancy. If disabled, all S3 multi-tenancy requests are rejected.

property.name: ozone.om.multitenancy.ranger.sync.interval
property.description: Determines how often the Multi-Tenancy Ranger background sync thread service should run. Background thread periodically checks Ranger policies and roles created by Multi-Tenancy feature. And overwrites them if obvious discrepancies are detected. Value should be set with a unit suffix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.multitenancy.ranger.sync.timeout
property.description: The timeout for each Multi-Tenancy Ranger background sync thread run. If the timeout has been reached, a warning message will be logged.

property.name: ozone.client.fs.default.bucket.layout
property.description: Default bucket layout value used when buckets are created using OFS. Supported values are LEGACY and FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED. FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED: This layout allows the bucket to support atomic rename/delete operations and also allows interoperability between S3 and FS APIs. Keys written via S3 API with a "/" delimiter will create intermediate directories.
